programme.desc: In 2008, college co-ed Jenna Verhaalen was found dead in her Bryan, Texas apartment and petechial hemorrhages in her eyes indicated that she was strangled.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: James Kenneth Elmen Jr. abducted Julie Estes, then 21, from the Southside convenience store where she worked in 1985. He raped and murdered her. Her body was found the next day, but the killing went unsolved until 2003.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence collected by a prescient medical examiner could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 20, 2001, Carrie Nelson, then 20, was beaten to death while working alone in a park office. The case went unsolved for six years until May 2007 when police found a match with DNA samples gathered from the crime scene.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an off-duty policeman was shot dead, his fellow officers were determined to solve the crime. They needed clues to find the killer, and they discovered them in tiny fibers and an asthma inhaler.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When¾two women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Tiffany Rowell and three of her friends were brutally murdered in their affluent Clear Lake, Texas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy socialite died after falling down the stairs, witnesses said one thing and evidence indicated another. To find out what really happened, investigators turned to forensic science, a physicist and an expert in accident reconstruction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Patrick McRae was found dead in his Des Moines home and the crime scene was awash with blood. Analysis showed it had come from two people, one of whom was female.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Shamaia Smith disappeared from the strip club she worked at in East Hartford, CT. Police look at various customers of the strip club, but focus on local businessman Kenneth Otto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman had been sexually assaulted, stabbed repeatedly, and left for dead. When someone who fit that description practically turned himself in, police were sure they had their man... until the DNA evidence proved them wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young, attractive hairdresser was sexually assaulted and murdered in her own beauty salon. The evidence at the crime scene didn't match any of the suspects and, after the initial investigation, the case went cold for ten years.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A twelve-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibers on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman attends evening church services... then disappears. When her abandoned car is found, the tank is empty and a gas can she kept in her trunk for emergencies is missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Kathy Lorick was murdered on a Concord, California jogging trail in the middle of the day while talking to her husband on her mobile phone.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The medical examiner ruled the death an accident, but the detectives investigating the case thought the evidence at the scene indicated otherwise.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decade-old murder of a young Texas housewife is investigated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This episode documents a deadly bombing at a church in Oakwood, Illinois, in December 1997.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was a self-made man who never minced words. Perhaps he was murdered by a disgruntled client or employee. Perhaps the racy photos in his safe held the clue to solving the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young man was killed in a mysterious car crash, but the evidence at the scene led investigators to believe it was not an accident. Forensic science revealed what really happened, and the truth devastated three families.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman is found dead in her apartment. With little evidence at the scene, the case turns cold... until police discover a link between their prime suspect and an unsolved murder committed six years earlier in a different state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In little more than a month, two women who lived in the same apartment complex were brutally murdered. The similarities of the crime scenes led police to conclude they were dealing with a serial killer who harbored an intense hatred of women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Texas real estate agent Sarah Anne Walker was found brutally murdered in a model home. Weeks later, a witness came forward who may have seen the killer. Police used forensic hypnosis to help him recall every detail of the man's appearance.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35, was convicted of killing David Nixon in April 2002 after he planned to end their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman was found dead on the bedroom floor of her apartment. The crime scene yielded little of value, and investigators wondered if they would find enough evidence to make a case, much less catch a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When¾two women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim has been stabbed more than thirty times, and the crime scene is awash with her blood. Near her head, police discover a distinctive button with strands of thread still attached.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the 'dirt' on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman could have lost control of her SUV on the icy road, and plunged down an embankment into a shallow creek. But there were footprints in the snow leading away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a dedicated, well-respected teacher disappeared, police had to determine if she'd gone on vacation without telling anyone, or if she was the victim of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home, and the only evidence¾the kidnapper¾left behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, the body of college co-ed Laura Salmon was found on a Middle Tennessee farm, covered with her own denim jeans as well as the jeans of the killer.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, construction manager Darrell North was found dead in his work trailer in Ft. Worth, Texas. When investigators arrived, they found that he had been stabbed 46 times, indicating a personal relationship between the victim and the attacker.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A surgeon is stabbed to death, and the most likely suspect is seen in a restaurant at the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, St. Cloud teenager Jason MacLennan returned home after a night out with friends and discovered his father Ken's body lying in a pool of blood.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman in the back of the truck was flailing her arms, screaming. They thought she was doing something dangerous for the fun of it. But when they found a jacket near a pool of blood, they knew what they'd seen wasn't a joy ride.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead, and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator. With the help of a forensic geologist, they identified the most unlikely suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy man and his wife were attacked by three masked men outside their luxurious Louisiana home. He was shot dead and she was forced to open their hidden safe. To solve the crime, police would have to find out who knew about the concealed safe.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Judy Southern arrived home from work and was shot by a gunman waiting within. Her husband Allen arrived shortly afterwards, called 911 to report his wife had been shot and drove her to the hospital.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It's usually easy to determine how a criminal entered the crime scene. But in this case, it was far from clear. It looked like the killer vanished into thin air...and perhaps he had.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a respected police officer was murdered in her own home. The crime went unsolved for more than a decade, and then a newly formed Cold Case Unit took a fresh look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy socialite died after falling down the stairs, witnesses said one thing and evidence indicated another. To find out what really happened, investigators turned to forensic science, a physicist and an expert in accident reconstruction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After the suspect was convicted of arson and murder, he maintained his innocence but was sentenced to 25 years in prison. He turned to the law books in the prison library and TV about forensic science and set out to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1969, 25-year-old phone operator¾Diane Maxwell is raped and murdered. Her brother promised he'd find out who was responsible and bring the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: James Kenneth Elmen Jr. abducted Julie Estes, then 21, from the Southside convenience store where she worked in 1985. He raped and murdered her. Her body was found the next day, but the killing went unsolved until 2003.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A bullet-riddled car, a missing driver, and no witnesses. Was this an ambush or a random attack? Had the victim been abducted or was she dead? The answers lay in a unique clue, so tiny it was measured in millionths of a meter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Nevada politician Kathy Augustine died mysteriously during a hard-fought re-election campaign and the medical examiner could neither isolate the cause of death, nor explain the tiny puncture wounds discovered during the autopsy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The killer probably hoped to cover his tracks by staging the crime scene. But investigators saw through the attempt almost immediately, and turned to forensic science to learn what really happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Virginia Beach police arrive at the Makdessi apartment to find Elise Makdessi and her lover Quincy Brown dead.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When newlywed Trina Winston goes missing, her family initially fears she’s fallen back into the old drug habits she’s worked so hard to move past. But as police start looking for her, they learn there are even more sinister secrets lurking in the background – including the dangerous past her new husband is trying to hide.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When the family of Shalisa O’Dell find her beaten to death at home, police immediately look at her boyfriend and ex as suspects. But as they uncover more about Shalisa, including her moonlighting job at a gentleman’s club, the suspect list grows. Did someone develop a deadly obsession with Shalisa, or does this murder hit closer to home?

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a series of brazen, armed robberies strike local businesses in a tranquil community in Wisconsin, detectives find themselves with few clues to help them identify the perpetrators. That is, until police track down real-life Bonnie and Clyde willing to risk it all in the name of love.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A gifted high school cheerleader�s bright plans for the future turn dark when she falls in love with an up-and-coming rapper and ex-con. Before long, she finds herself going down a road to trouble by hiding her relationship and risking her future in order to appease her man.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: Griselda Cassamajor, an aspiring young entrepreneur in the healthcare industry, had the ambition and smarts to make her dreams come true. And outside of work, she was no stranger to love. But her promising future comes to a screeching halt on a searing summer day in Florida when a jilted soul succumbs to his darkest impulses, leaving two unsuspecting victims in his wake.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When pregnant mother Megan Price is found dead in her home, there’s evidence that multiple people didn’t want her new baby to see the light of day. But a storm of clues keep leading to dead ends – until an unexpected witness comes forward with a story of a loose-lipped killer.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a former Miss Bahamas contestant disappears in Florida, her family fears something horrible has happened to her. As detectives start investigating, they quickly focus on a jealous boyfriend and a secret hook-up with an off-duty cop – until an unexpected discovery reveals the horrifying last moments of the beauty queen.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a woman unlucky in love meets a smooth-talking older man, she thinks she has finally found someone to start a life with. But when detectives come knocking on her door after a woman goes missing, they discover a woman willing to do whatever it took to keep her man satisfied.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a young woman is released from prison, she is determined to live her life on the straight and narrow; however, her efforts are derailed after she falls hard for a handsome stranger who drags her down into a dark place.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: Vince and Quinn are approached by a colleague for help in a cold case where a young man was found shot to death on a sidewalk. Detectives will have to go the extra mile to find the owner of this car and ultimately the killer of this innocent victim.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: A young woman is killed in a flashy car riddled with bullets in a quiet Atlanta suburb. Detectives Quinn and Vince can tell this was a shootout with multiple gunmen, and left to determine whether she was the intended target, or a mistaken identity.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a young mother is found stabbed over 30 times, police wonder, could it be a revenge killing, the act of a jealous ex, or a crime of passion by a current lover?

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: The city of Atlanta has a rich history but with the city’s explosive growth, corruption has made its way into local politics. For one local Sheriff, a valiant attempt to clean it up results in a stunning, violent crime.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: Columbus, Ohio is often described as a big city with a small-town personality. The community is left reeling when a hard-working local teenager is gunned down, and his own twin brother is arrested for the crime.

programme.title: Find Our Missing
programme.desc: A well-to-do Program Analyst goes missing from her affluent home in the nation�s capitol. A 5-year-old disabled boy disappears from a busy Oakland, California neighborhood. They are two of the countless unsolved missing persons cases in the U.S. Help find our missing.

programme.desc: When a man loses control of his wife and kids, he goes to murderous lengths to get revenge.

programme.title: Bloomberg Originals
programme.desc: Bloomberg Originals offers bold takes for curious minds on today’s biggest topics. programme.title: Projecting Protest
programme.desc: Pushing the boundaries of freedom of speech, a new wave of public protest involves projecting imagery onto prominent buildings. Features interviews with activists.

programme.title: Ship to Shelf: Tariff Tensions
programme.desc: How trade tensions and tariffs are impacting vital imports through our ports, the prices we pay, jobs and employment, and even the toy industry.

programme.title: Animals on the Farm
programme.desc: In this episode we go down on the farm to explore the science of the cow's 4-chambered stomach. Learn about the mysterious muscle disorder that makes certain types of goats faint. Plus, find out what horsepower really is.

programme.title: South America's Coolest Creatures
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of South America. Find out how the Jaguar's jaws are able to crush bone. And why the Galapagos Tortoise can grow to nearly 1,000 lbs.

programme.title: Alaska
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the wild frontier of Alaska. He takes a trip deep into bear country and witnesses a brown bear hunting for salmon. We fly through the Denali National Park and land on a glacier near the tallest mountain in North America. Philippe goes scuba diving in the frigid waters near the Kenai Peninsula and discovers an abundance of sea life. Then Philippe tries his hand at panning for gold, which is still plentiful throughout Alaska.

programme.title: Strange Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits some unusual geological wonders on our planet. He explores the Petrified National Forest where 200 million year old trees have turned into rock. We visit Crater Lake in Oregon, one of the deepest and bluest lakes in the world. Philippe scuba dives off the Southern California coast and discovers a giant forest of kelp. And we visit New Zealand, which has caves that feature glowworms that light up these dark caverns.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: How The Show Is Made
programme.desc: Photowalks host Jefferson Graham takes you behind the scenes, showing you how he shoots the show on his iPhone - offering tips for your own photos.

programme.title: Blockchain Revolution
programme.desc: Blockchain technology is sweeping the globe, moving from high-flying cryptocurrencies to our health care and out food supply. But is it safe? And can it be trusted?

programme.title: Engineering A Pro
programme.desc: The face of baseball is rapidly changing. The next generation of major league stars are using cutting-edge science and technology to drive their performance to unprecedented heights.

programme.title: Noah's Ark For Humans
programme.desc: Within a few decades many bacteria our bodies depend on will have disappeared, so scientists are racing to create a vault for Human Microbiota like a Noah's Ark for the future of the human species.

programme.title: Extreme Wildfire Combat
programme.desc: Wildfires have greatly increased in size and intensity over the past few years, now breaking records. New tools using cutting-edge technology are being developed to help save property and lives.

programme.title: Caught On Clips
programme.desc: The wildest, wackiest, and most jaw-dropping videos. From dangerous severe weather, to heart-stopping close calls and adorable animal antics - all caught on camera.

programme.title: Descent Into Anarchy
programme.desc: The human toll as Haiti's paramilitary gangs use automatic weapons, child soldiers and sexual violence to terrorize.

programme.title: Noah's Ark For Humans

programme.title: Extreme Wildfire Combat
programme.desc: Wildfires have greatly increased in size and intensity over the past few years, now breaking records. New tools using cutting-edge technology are being developed to help save property and lives.

programme.title: Run For Your Life
programme.desc: A cheating wife demands a deadly favor from a lover in Centre Hall, PA, and a Christmas Party holds the key to a murder in Lincolnshire, England.

programme.title: Lust, Lies And Alibis
programme.desc: An affair with a karate instructor in Oregon leads to some killer blows, and in England a millionaire hides a dark secret.

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.title: Operation Citzens Band: CB Trojan Horse
programme.desc: Quincy, MA cop Ernie Lijoi goes undercover to take down an enterprising drug dealer who is renting out weapons to other criminals. To get inside this gang of dirt bags, Ernie becomes Mr. Fix It, with a flair for installing CB radios in the gangs' vehicles. Ernie is crazy like a fox because the drug dealers use the radios to do their drug deals, all the while being monitored by cops. But can Ernie build a case against the gang before he's discovered to be a snitch?

programme.title: Operation Grey Sunset: Montana Freeman
programme.desc: FBI Special Agent Tim Healy infiltrates a dangerous anti-government group called the Montana Freemen who are running a scam to bilk the IRS out of millions to fund their planned Armageddon. Tim befriends the Freemen mastermind to get inside the compound and lure him out into the arms of the FBI. But will the plan blow up in Tim's face when he's discovered to be working undercover?

programme.title: Alaska
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the wild frontier of Alaska. He takes a trip deep into bear country and witnesses a brown bear hunting for salmon. We fly through the Denali National Park and land on a glacier near the tallest mountain in North America. Philippe goes scuba diving in the frigid waters near the Kenai Peninsula and discovers an abundance of sea life. Then Philippe tries his hand at panning for gold, which is still plentiful throughout Alaska.

programme.title: Strange Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits some unusual geological wonders on our planet. He explores the Petrified National Forest where 200 million year old trees have turned into rock. We visit Crater Lake in Oregon, one of the deepest and bluest lakes in the world. Philippe scuba dives off the Southern California coast and discovers a giant forest of kelp. And we visit New Zealand, which has caves that feature glowworms that light up these dark caverns.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: How The Show Is Made
programme.desc: Photowalks host Jefferson Graham takes you behind the scenes, showing you how he shoots the show on his iPhone - offering tips for your own photos.

programme.desc: Blockchain technology is sweeping the globe, moving from high-flying cryptocurrencies to our health care and out food supply. But is it safe? And can it be trusted?

programme.desc: The face of baseball is rapidly changing. The next generation of major league stars are using cutting-edge science and technology to drive their performance to unprecedented heights.

programme.title: Noah's Ark For Humans
programme.desc: Within a few decades many bacteria our bodies depend on will have disappeared, so scientists are racing to create a vault for Human Microbiota like a Noah's Ark for the future of the human species.

programme.title: Extreme Wildfire Combat
programme.desc: Wildfires have greatly increased in size and intensity over the past few years, now breaking records. New tools using cutting-edge technology are being developed to help save property and lives.

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.title: Operation Citzens Band: CB Trojan Horse
programme.desc: Quincy, MA cop Ernie Lijoi goes undercover to take down an enterprising drug dealer who is renting out weapons to other criminals. To get inside this gang of dirt bags, Ernie becomes Mr. Fix It, with a flair for installing CB radios in the gangs' vehicles. Ernie is crazy like a fox because the drug dealers use the radios to do their drug deals, all the while being monitored by cops. But can Ernie build a case against the gang before he's discovered to be a snitch?

programme.title: Operation Grey Sunset: Montana Freeman
programme.desc: FBI Special Agent Tim Healy infiltrates a dangerous anti-government group called the Montana Freemen who are running a scam to bilk the IRS out of millions to fund their planned Armageddon. Tim befriends the Freemen mastermind to get inside the compound and lure him out into the arms of the FBI. But will the plan blow up in Tim's face when he's discovered to be working undercover?
